intro: Pleroma gaudichaudianum, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Pleroma gaudichaudianum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, warm climate of its native habitat.
